website_summaries.verdict: These freestanding toilet support rails are good for shorter users.
pros: Freestanding design to fit standard and elongated-seat toilets
Tool-free assembly.Width between arms is 21 inches
cons: No rubber feet on bottom to prevent slipping, but this is easy to add at home

customer_reviews.title: Solid Safety Rail - Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought my disabled mother a bidet toilet seat. This made her regular safety rail which attached to toilet unusable. This is my solution for that problem. It is a TERRIFIC solution. It is solid, very easy to put together and very well made. If I had seen it in person before ordering it, I would have expected to pay twice as much. Also, my mom is paralyzed on one side and so puts most of her weight on one side only when rising from the toilet. This is STILL SAFE. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: EBLy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for a man
customer_reviews.text: I had previously reviewed this as a good product - boy was I wrong! Do not buy for use buy a man who stands to urinate. The support bar at the bottom kept my dad from getting close enough to pee in the toilet so most everything wound up on the floor. Ugh! Lots of embarrassment for him and cleaning for me until I hauled it out and got a replacement in another design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Light Weight, Slides Easily, Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This rail needs to be modified to be able to be safely used on any surface other than carpet. If you do not add some kind of rubber to the base it will slide on tile/wood floors making whoever is using it on the floor and probably on the way to the hospital. The other reviews to not address this and we are very disappointed in its inability to function as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan May

customer_reviews.title: great assistance for after surgery
customer_reviews.text: This toilet rail was a tremendous help to my husband who had surgery and was unable to comfortably lower himself or stand from the toilet without extreme discomfort and support from someone else. It was really easy to assemble and install and is sturdy, really sturdy. It has served it's purpose for us and I would definitely recommend this exact instrument for someone who requires potty assistance , whether it is for after surgery or for elderly person, or anyone who, for whatever reason, has issues with lowering of standing up from the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: quechris

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and well made. Sturdy and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: No tools required. Each bolt has twist handles for hand tightening. Connecting tubes have captured nuts. Nothing to fiddle with or lose. To my amazement each time I made a connection the bolt threads found the nut threads right away...and properly. No cross threading. This delighted me. Fluke or good design, I don't know. It is nice and sturdy when assembled. Their are small rubber foot pads under the steel and it doesn't slide on our floor. Full recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a 300 lb man recovering from hip surgery.
customer_reviews.text: I used this device for about four months before and after hip surgery; wish I'd had it a couple years ago, recovering from double knee surgery. Due to my girth and "thick bones" I installed the handles 'turned out' at the top, instead of in. Regular and, especially, small persons will probably want to assemble it with the handles angled 'in' as shown in the advertised pictures and assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Solid material but does not stay in place well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife who is a lower leg amputee Very easy to put together and made out of solid material however it does not stay in place very well .... it shifted on her while she was transferring and she fell...k we had to call the paramedics to get her back into her wheelchair...ordering a different type and this will be going bac. this would be ok for someone who has arthritis but not very stable for someone with any kind of disability or balancing issues
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Super strong but takes space.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Box is damaged but contents are fine. I ordered white but received biscuit color. Easy assembly took less than 5 minutes and no tools needed. Very sturdy but stability depends on proper use as it will tip forward if handles are grasped too close to the front. Likewise, will tip sideways if too much weight applied to only one side. There is a shower chair in the tub so the bottom and side rails make it impossible for him to get in and out. He loves the support getting off & on his ADA height toilet. It's just to big for his bathroom and may create more hazard than help. Definitely not good for small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: NOT STABLE
customer_reviews.text: This is not a stable product, even with the bars across the bottom. I am 5'7", weigh 130 lbs and this keeps tipping over anytime I try to use it to stand up. I haven't figured out if the height can be adjusted but from just looking at it, it cannot. Raising it may help keep it balanced.
customer_reviews.author: AtoZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect safety rail for toilet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my 90 year old grandmother does not allow anyone to come into the bathroom with her, but she has had a couple of falls. She has been using this for 3 years now, and it helps her get back up from a sitting position without assistance. I trust it's sturdiness and it fits perfectly without having to dismantle the restroom.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great help for my elderly parent!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my elderly mother who mainly needs assistance standing up from the toilet. It arrived quickly, assembled in 5 minutes and is working out great for her. I considered ordering the kind that attaches to the toilet seat bolts as I was concerned that this might modelbe in the way and might pose a trip hazard with the floor rails extending out too far. After reading reviews of the instability of that model, I'm glad I went with this one - it is sturdy, is not in the way and doesn't seem like tripping is a danger.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Jane's Mimi

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNEY
customer_reviews.text: Came packaged with everything I needed to assemble- instruction booklet included - easy to follow instructions. I put it together in less than 15 minutes with NO help from my husband. Tried it out and it is fantastic - did NOT tip or slide - I ordered the tape to go on the bottom like someone had suggested but won’t need it. WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND FOR PEOPLE HAVING A HARD TIME GETTING OFF TOILET!
customer_reviews.author: bula girl

customer_reviews.title: Stable and strong - no more falls!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a disabled friend who was suffering from a lot of falls in her bathroom. It was easy enough to assemble that a tiny disabled woman living alone had no trouble with putting it together. It’s completely stable even though she has poor balance and often puts most of her weight on it and regularly breaks items due to not having good control over her own strength. Since this safety rail arrived, she has not had a single fall in the bathroom. She’s thinking about buying another one for using with chairs since this one works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works with current narrower toilets.
customer_reviews.text: Regular commodes don’t fit on our modern toilet, and I was having difficulty finding something that would work for me following surgery. This has worked well. It’s a bit on the side side, but it has been stable enough to get me through this period. You can’t lean all on one side of the device, but it is very stable, and I have had no problems getting up in my awkwardness at present. It also has a side basket to keep what you need handy. I’m sure I’ll be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Design disaster.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing design disaster for someone like me, and I suspect many others. The bar across the front of the toilet prevents placing your feet where they need to be to get up with balance. When you place your hands where they need to be, it rocks back and forth. Unfortunately, it's too late to return it, and I won't donate it to the Senior Center--one more item for the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Dalsant

customer_reviews.title: Great assistance for elders does what it promises.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my dad to use toilet, This came on time and exactly as expected! It didn’t require any tools to set up and took about 5 min. Even better, it is very sturdy and has helped my dad a lot! If you are just sitting on the toilet, then it can move, but once you put weight on it to stand up it is very sturdy and doesn’t move. My dad puts a lot of weight on it and removes one hand before the other and it doesn’t wobble. He barely get up from the toilet before this, and now with this, it only takes his a minute or so. This is durable and long lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: USMANGEE79

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Best $40 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: My toilet does not have a wall on either side of it to mount rails. Old age was making it hard to get up and down, but recent knee surgery and the resulting 6 weeks of straight leg was making it extremely difficult. I ordered this, and 2 or 3 minutes of assembly put me in business. It is as easy to get on or off my toilet as if I was a healthy teenager. The only improvement I can think of would be to attach it to the toilet so that it would not slide around. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: M. Crow

customer_reviews.title: Unstable product when used with 1 hand
customer_reviews.text: Well made product that was easy to put together. However, this product is very unstable when using only one handle. When using this product, you must use both handles. I bought this product because my wife broke her right arm and left leg. The first time she tried to use it with her left arm, this product flipped up on the right side and she almost fell.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: able to put together quickly and easily - except for one hand-screw
customer_reviews.text: got the safety rail very quickly, which was great. Only issue we had -- one of the screws (that you install by hand -- no tools needed) would not go completely into the pre-drilled holes. We tried it in several of the holes, and ended only partially installing this one screw. We put it in the back, where it shouldn't have an impact. Other than that, it's been good to have to support my wife during her surgery recovery.
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: stable and portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for when my mom who has mobility issues visits so portability was important. Its stable! the provided pads on bottom prevent skidding so no need to add anti skid tape. Many reviews mentioned the lack of tape but they have addressed this issue. Mom says that it works fine for her so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kofi D

customer_reviews.title: I am having a total knee replacement next month and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am having a total knee replacement next month and was having trouble getting up from a sitting position. This really helps! Also we went on vacation a few weeks ago and my husband dismantled it and we took it with us. Hotel toilets are too low as a rule, so this really helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine

customer_reviews.title: Great aid!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for elderly parents but tried it myself irst. I am short and heavy but find it solid to use. If you put your weight to far forward it will tip but did not tip over. It is best used in a larger bathroom. I tried it in my small powder room and tripped on the front feet a couple of times. In my larger bathroom this was not a problem. Overall it is a definite help.
customer_reviews.author: JLBRN

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help my grandmother during her visits as she broke her hip last winter and has trouble getting up and down from low places / seats. We had tried purchasing a higher seat but found them difficult to fit on our toilet ... they were wobbly... so this seemed like another approach to take. It works quite well for us but the best part is that is very movable. We can move it and stow it away when not needed. We were a bit worried that it might not be sturdy enough to support her but it worked really well. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 82 year old mom who has arthritis and mobility issues. She walks with a cane and has trouble getting onto and off of the toilet because of bad knees. I purchased this stand and it was extremely easy to assemble (no tools whatsoever). Best of all, my mom loves it. It has made such a huge difference for her in using the bathroom. This was an awesome investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Love It. Perfect for hip replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY surprised about sturdiness of this product. Nephew assembled this, as I was at the hospital getting a hip replacement. I was worried that it would not hold my weight (250#), or would wear out too quickly. But....wow...easy to put together, sturdy and will be easy to take apart and then easy to store once my recovery is over (till the next surgery comes along!). Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Information4Ewe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: After my relatives with various issues - bad knees, arthritis, elderly, diabetic amputee - used my bathroom, they all wanted one. They're of a generation that's afraid of the Internet and ordering online so I've had to order 4 more of these for them and they reimbursed me. It's sturdiness with no need to attach it to a wall, floor or to the toilet itself is what impressed them. The bottom crosswise rails rest at the bottom of the toilet and the toilet and the person's weight keep it from sliding as you rise. It takes no excess room. It fits even in a really tight space like a toilet next to a sink or tub.
customer_reviews.author: Beezus

customer_reviews.title: bad threads
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to assemble this product for a senior citizen. The screws that come with it are intended to be hand tightened. We some screws stopped turning before reaching the end. Reason is bad threads. I even tried with pliers and still was not able to make them turn to the end. However, I like the product and I am going to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Myriam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go next to my toilet after foot/ankle surgery. It is very sturdy and works well. I had been looking for something like this that did NOT attach to my toilet. I love that it can be moved out of the way easily. I recently discovered that it is the right size to also assist me in getting in/out of my shower, so it is now serving a dual-purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Delehanty

customer_reviews.title: Great Support.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so when my mother comes over she can use the toilet with dignity. My mother is in her 80's and she has trouble getting up and out of chairs and off the toilet. This has provider her the freedom to visit my home and not feel like she needs to run home when needing to use the restroom. This is a very well built product, very stable and super easy to assemble and use. Recommended by my mother!!!
customer_reviews.author: SincLabs

customer_reviews.title: Works great...better on carpeting. A little short.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you push it right up against the toilet. It slides if it's not on carpeting so you will have to put something on the bottom so that it doesn't slide around. I had knee replacement and it was great...I was so glad to have it. I still am (two weeks out). One thing...it is short. I am 5'8" and it's really too short for me and not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: dreemsnake

customer_reviews.title: frame is bent or just not well designed
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to assemble and good for use, but the frame is not designed well and I've had to put a table wedge under the legs so that it doesn't wobble when my senior parent attempts to use it. The front legs also stick out very far and often trip her up. We will use for now, but a likely will need to find another solution that is more durable and safe for her needs.

customer_reviews.title: Helps to stand up from Seated position. Too low to help with sitting down though.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and works to help a stroke victim with weak legs stand up on his own. Its low to the ground so helps to lift off the toilet, but its so low that it is not very helpful in getting on the toilet. I.e., when approaching the toilet and leaning on a walker, the walker is much higher off the ground than this product. So the person wanting to lower himself onto the toilet by reaching down and grabbing these bars just finds it too low and awkward, if that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Beckeyz

customer_reviews.title: Trip Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy and easy to assemble, but is causes a huge trip hazard. my father in law has Parkinson's and Dementia and had many close calls after tripping on the legs that stick out past the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Kenya

customer_reviews.title: Works well, stable, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This Safety Rail product really helped after Achilles tendon surgery which required being non-weight bearing for 6 weeks. Made it easy to get up and down with out worrying about a slip or fall. It stayed in place well on a linoleum floor, seemed stable, was easy to assemble, and the book holder was a plus for holding a Kindle since it is hard to carry anything when you are on crutches. If needed, you can easily move this one to another bathroom since it is stand alone.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdwf

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome buy! We needed something for my elderly father who is quite large (6' tall and weighs over 200 lbs) for when he came to our summer cottage. The toilet is very low seated (installed back in 1950) and this little gem helps him get on and off the toilet with ease! It's easy to install, easy to clean and easy to disassemble. So glad we found this (as him pulling himself up off the toilet using the towel racks sigh...) totally gives me peace of mind and him safe :)
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong And Useful !
customer_reviews.text: I Actually Bought This For Another Purpose ! I Had Knee And Hip Replaced And Needed Something Portable That I Could Have Where Needed To Use To Use My Arms To Help Me Stand Up From Kneeling Position As Legs Not Strong Or Flexible Enough To Get Up Yet Without Extra Support ! This Worked Perfect , Is Stable To Pull Myself Up From Kneeling ! Well Built And Plenty Strong While Light Weight ! Would Buy Again !
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Lawler

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for my Mom!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to help my Mom be as independent as possible, getting up and down from the toilet became an issue. It hurt her hips, knees, and arms and shoulders to try and pull herself up and ease herself down again. I ordered this for her, put it together in my garage where I had more room, delivered to her small apartment, and installed around her toilet in seconds. The rest is history. She has enjoyed the effortless trips to the bathroom ever since, and now the family doesn't have to worry about her falling or injuring herself. Wonderful product! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend sho travels with us.This product is awesome! Easy to put together, store away when not needed and take on trips. This is also great for your occasional visitor who needs a assistance. It's sturdy and my friend felt safe using this rail.
customer_reviews.author: 2busy4bs

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this safety rail can tip forward if you grip the hand rails at the front ends! If gripped in the center of the hand rails, the product works as designed. Since I could not install any other type of safety rail on my existing toilet because of the low slung toilet design, I had to use some sort of free standing hand rail system. I solved my problem with this product by installing U shaped brackets over the rear ends of the horizontal bases which I screwed into the floor. Now it does not tip no matter where you grip the hand rails.
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: Possible tripping hazard.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) Easy to put together. 2) Sturdy. Cons: 1) The outer parallel bars on the floor could cause a tripping hazard. They extend out by about 3”. 2) The horizontal bars in front, on the bottom, can’t be moved back. I have already tripped on them already and I just got it 6 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sand

customer_reviews.title: Knee surgery life saver
customer_reviews.text: This stand is a life saver for my father and was so useful during my knee surgery. It worked great for individuals between 100-200lbs. It was a bit tough to assemble and sits against the pedestal base so can be a bit annoying when moving around small bathrooms. I wouldn't go through another surgery without it.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elderly mother, who needs help getting off the toilet. This unit fits the space perfectly and gives her the stability she needs to get herself up. The only issue is the space between the handles is a little narrow for her, but we're making do. Overall, we're very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easy to use. Sturdy steal construction. The hand rails are cushioned foam-like material. Problem is that the bottom rails that sit on the floor are metal and easily slide on my tile floor. Had to put non skid tape on the bottom of the rails. Would be better if the manufacturer put non skid pads or tape on the rails that sit on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: RicC

customer_reviews.title: Feels unstable.
customer_reviews.text: There are no grips on the bottom of this stand to keep it from moving around next bathroom tile. This very obvious design flaw makes the whole thing slide around a lot and feel very unstable. Not good for the elderly or people with injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Leo A. Federico

customer_reviews.title: This works great for when we have company that needs to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great for when we have company that needs to use it. Great alternative to a permanent bar being installed. However, it is a little low for those using it. We have comfort height toilets but nothing very tall and it really doesn’t give them enough leverage to easily push themselves off the toilet. I wish this product had an adjustable height.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Easy to put together without tools !
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Heavy duty. No tools needed to assemble. One suggestion is to keep looking at the picture in between steps to make sure all 4 pieces are pointing the way they should be before tightening any wingnuts. If you've laid it out wrong, and tightened it, you will need a set of plyers to loosen the wingnuts. If any of the holes are not punched through quite enough, a phillips screwdriver and a hammer will work. A great solid product for the price. All the other toilet aids I've seen require taking the toilet seat off to install, and with old rusted hardware attached, that can be difficult.
customer_reviews.author: one big cheeze

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my spouse whose health issues cause unsteadiness, particularly going from sitting to standing. I like that it's a stand-alone unit that does not interfere with the bidet we installed (Luxe bidet Neo 120). It's super easy to assemble, no tools necessary. It seems sturdy. My only criticism is that the height of the arms is not adjustable, but the height works for both me (5'5") and him (5'10") so the manufacturer figured out a useable average height. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pete and/or Helen McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: So much better than using a walker to get off the toilet!
customer_reviews.text: Got these after my knee replacement - they make it so much easier to get off the toilet than using a walker! Very Stable - highly recommend to anyone who needs assistance getting up!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: The ease of assembly and use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase of this item. Easy to put together and no more pain on sitting or rising Yippee. This stand has a tendency to tip a little forward when rising, but a firm grip and eaqual pressure on each hand grip allows one to stand up with no problems. I like that it is basically portable o it can be moved without problems I am a 77 yo woman and I was able to assemble this stand with no help in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Spears

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Safety Rail
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my wife after knee replacement surgery and she loves it. It's very stable and well-constructed. It will slide on a tile floor so I put 4 1" round non-slip pads on each leg bottom and that fixed the issue. It should fit around just about any toilet. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: doctorjlt

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Got rails for my husband who had knee surgery and it worked wonderfully. You had to put both hands on rail when you stood up but that’s what your suppose to do anyway. Just slides in front of the toliet. Much much better than the seat they sent us from doctors office.
customer_reviews.author: tlbalto

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to have Knee Surgery you need this!  A Lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: Had knee surgery - needed something to get on and off the toilet - didn't know I needed this until I tried my first toilet adventure - then I ordered it as a last resort - this Safety Rail along with my walker really did the job for me. Well made and easy to put together in minutes - we have the elongated low bowl and I wasn't sure it would do the job but it has not failed me. I am now in my 6th week of recovery and couldn't have gotten this far without it. This took the biggest worry I had about recovery out of play. I weigh 230 lbs. - you can trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Val F. Marz

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you have no balance.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say Amazon customer service was wonderful and returned the money spent on this item, which is unreturnable. I tried to return due to safety reasons. The leg sticks out too far from the toilet and is a tripping hazard. Also, it isn't very steady.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Poland

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I just had ankle surgery and this is my hardest obstacle ....with no weight on ankle. I found this searching Amazon ....Happy Happy works great , I had nothing too hold on too to get up, I’ve never seen this before . Highly recommend for post surgery 😁
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item for physically challenged
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent item. It was easy and simple to assemble, it is light weight, but strong. Being lightweight, it is maneuverable which makes it very easy to use and place where it is required.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for rails that attached to the screws that hold down my elderly mom’s toilet seat. I installed a bidet seat for her and needed a free-standing rail instead. This one was easy to assemble and move into position. The only thing I didn’t really like is that the stabilizing feet stick out and you can stub your toe on them. I solved this by just putting some foam pipe insulation on them.
customer_reviews.author: Su808

customer_reviews.title: Aside from wrong installation instructions, a solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid stand alone arms for support when sitting or standing from a toilet or chair. Easy to assemble which was terrific because the instructions that came in the box were for a totally different product. Interestingly the assembled product feels lighter than the product in the box.
customer_reviews.author: afpadc

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure, I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this appliance. It fit perfectly around my toilet and while the grab bars are a little low, it’s still is a great addition to my comfort. Being able to get up and down off the toilet safely, is a great addition to my home. Thank you, for providing me the security that I need.
customer_reviews.author: June J. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: If you have an older parent that needs help off the toilet then try this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father. He is old and can’t move very well. He pulled the towel rack off the wall numerous times trying to help himself op off the toilet. So far it has worked perfectly. Doesn’t even look that bad in the bathroom. I highly recommend this or something like it.
customer_reviews.author: MrKushmann

customer_reviews.title: The design is great. Just one of 8 screws I could not ...
customer_reviews.text: The design is great. Just one of 8 screws I could not install because thread on steel bars was not perfect. So I took the screw to the local hardware store and I bought a solid head steel screw and used a ratcheting wrench to improve the thread. Then I was able to install the supplied plastic head screw using hand. The product works but not perfect if it needs screw threader to assemble. The steel head screw cost me less than $ 2.00 which is still cheaper than buying screw threader or returning it with no guarantee that the new will have a zero thread problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.  Povilai

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product! I added the rubber tips as recommended by other users and it works great on my tile floors. Bought for my elderly mother. Didn’t want to install hand rails on my bathroom walls so this was the perfect solution. It has given her so much support and confidence. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jane H

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: read the reviews and was skeptical with some of the comments that it was difficult to put together and it may slide I was pleasantly surprised could not be easier it does not slide as many of comments said but they did stress they had added some rubber under it and now it is perfect and I don't have to worry that my husband and I will have a difficult time sitting down or standing up
customer_reviews.author: halie

customer_reviews.title: Broke my ankle and have a non-weight bearing cast for ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke my ankle and have a non-weight bearing cast for 8 weeks. The design of my bathroom made it impossible for me to stand up from the toilet without support. There are several models for sale on Amazon and we considered each carefully and finally choose the Drive Stand Alone. The "no-tool" assembly was a breeze. VERY secure and stable. It works perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.author: californiabell

customer_reviews.title: Like other buyers
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for husband who has cast on leg. Like other buyers, I attached 2-sided tape to base of sides (Scotch brand outdoor mounting tape, found in paint dept at Home Depot - about $6), then cut rubbery shelf liner to cover tape. Keeps railing steady & protects floor tile at same time.
customer_reviews.author: KSunny

customer_reviews.title: All Adults Will Enjoy Benefits From Using This Safety Rail
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand alone toilet safety rail about six months ago. I'm 63 and my old knee injury was bothering me. After a few days the pain and weakness was gone, so I stored it in a closet. Anyway, about a month ago I decided to assemble and give it a try. Wow, what an amazing difference it makes. Sitting down and getting up is so much easier now. I should have purchased one of these twenty years ago. I highly recommend this stand alone toilet safety rail for all adult individuals. It's not just for injured people and elderly senior citizens. All adults will enjoy the security, comfort and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: M. DeRight

customer_reviews.title: Great Seller & Product!
customer_reviews.text: Even during these troubled times, this Seller kept his word & shipped it to me! In fact, I got it a day earlier than I was promised! This object is as the Seller described it! I will use this Seller again as needed!
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but iffy quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: As others found, the quality control is hit or miss. My husband had to tap for one of the screws. If you don't have someone on hand who can correct & make the thing go together, it could be a problem. Also, as other reviewers pointed out, you have to put cork strips, or something on the bottom rails to protect tile & keep the unit from moving. I wish it were a bit taller, but I'm pretty tall. Once together, it does what it says it will do..
customer_reviews.author: KLT -Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and supports my weight perfectly. I liked that it was free standing instead of having to attach to anything. Helped through a knee injury.
customer_reviews.author: scorpios

customer_reviews.title: it would have been very painful to use the toilet
customer_reviews.text: WOW! i still can't believe the price for this thing and the quality. I weigh nearly 250lbs and this thing is solid as a rock. I was prepping to have total hip replacement and without this, it would have been very painful to use the toilet. Thankful for the strength and quality of the product and the ease in which it was easy to assemble. fits perfectly and can be easily taken out of the way for family members who don't need it. No need to disassemble your toilet seat... this thing is secure all on it's own. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: daniel coronado

customer_reviews.title: These are great! They work with my "all in one" toilet perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is in rehab after a mild heart attack and stents and has Parkinson's Disease. We had to make the home safe before he could come home. I put one of these in each bathroom. They are great and very sturdy. I had tried to use the kind that attach to the commode itself but they would not work because we have the "all in one toilet" from Kohler and no one makes one that will fit this style of toilet. But these will certainly fit the bill. I like them for myself also!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lindeman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Put Together, Easy to Use, Easy to move  - Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: My mom has stage six alzheimers with arthritis really bad and we got this because of reviews and it was easy for us to move on and off and it works great. The 4 star reviews said it was hard to put together (no problems here) and that it slid - it has not on our floor - I'm assuming those negatives have to do with person putting together and the floor's surface. I would highly recommend this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: The level where the magazine rack is not made to grab for assistance
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. My mother feels comfortable with the stability of this and it’s a perfect height. She is 5”3 , but I’m 5”5 and I’ve tried it, and it’s comfortable to use. I’m glad I have this. I feel secure knowing she has this to use in the middle of the night, now I leave it up all day so she always has assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Total Knee Replacement Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Stand Alone Safety Rail because I was going to have a Total Knee Replacement Surgery coming up. I am too short for a toilet seat riser, so I was glad when I found this rail system. It was perfect for me when trying to get up after my surgery. I still keep it around the toilet just in case I might need to grab onto something to stand. It was easy to put together and is stable once it is set around your toilet. I would recommend it anyone that might have stability issues when either sitting down or standing up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea R. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Product With Easy Assembly, Buy It You Can Not Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: A very amazing product, with great stability and ease of use. My dad simply loves it and very easy to assemble for him. Sadly he purchased a cheaper one that cost around $60.00 with shipping. I would highly recommend this one. Took less then 5mins to put it together. Arrived in two days, great seller.
customer_reviews.author: USNavyVet

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and not too big
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to accompany a hinged toilet seat riser. It is sturdy and doesn't take up too much space. My family member prefers these handles to those that were attached to a previous toilet seat riser.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative for a Temporary Situation
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to assemble & disassemble although I don't see the need for the magazine rack. Fit around my toilet without creating a tripping hazard. It was a good solution to a commode or higher toilet seat while I was non-weight bearing on one leg for 6 weeks after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Me in SJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth to buy to prevent fall in the br
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to support my gait after surgery then I found this after several searching. It is very convenient when you cannot install rails in the bathroom. The size was perfect for our small bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Lu K

customer_reviews.title: I love this stand
customer_reviews.text: After hip replacement the dr sent me home with a bedside commode that has a removable pail so it can be placed over the toilet. I hated it but I love this stand! It’s so handy and I feel secure getting up and down. It isn’t bulky but it’s solid!
customer_reviews.author: Sandorae

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver for anyone of any age who has knee problems. It's a breeze to put together and takes about 5 minutes tops - no screws. It takes all pressure off those knees. I simply love this.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stand alone post-surgery helper
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item prior to total knee replacement surgery, not wanting to attach anything to my permanent bathroom fixture (which is extended and comfort height) and not wanting anyone to have to clean the underside of the plastic seat of a portable convertible commode. It fits perfectly in my narrow bathroom. It's sturdy. And the price was right. I thought it was simple enough to assemble, too. It filled the bill, and I will (almost) miss it now that I'm on the road to recovery. I am glad I purchased this, especially after seeing the commode/raised seat equipment the hospital would have sent me home with.
customer_reviews.author: Helenanne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy support
customer_reviews.text: This support makes it much easier for me to go to the bathroom. The arms let me push myself up from the toilet independently. I read some reviews stating that this aid was difficult to assemble but my husband had it together within a few minutes. I would recommend this to anyone needing help getting up from the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Wefarm2

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A WONDERFUL PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman 78 years old and got the package about 1 hr. ago. Opened the package and put it together. Very easy and absolutely no tools only fingers needed. Being disabled I look for things to make life a little better and I found it. I have used a commode for years and have just found that I can sit on the toilet seat (with lots of exercise through the past year.) So thank you DRIVE for making this product and thank you Amazon for getting it to me so quickly
customer_reviews.author: THE WALKER

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews/questions say the stand fits (not assembled) into a large suitcase. I liked that because the hotels we stay out often have short toilets. Won’t fit in my large suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: DTB

customer_reviews.title: Elderly Parent Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our elderly parent who had an injured knee. Very easy assembly and very supportive in it's use. She absolutely love it and helps makes her life a bit easier. We would recommend to anyone who wants something that's very helpful and stable for their loved ones. Great toilet safety handles!
customer_reviews.author: SonnyD

customer_reviews.title: Great Device~~
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent device for folks who have had kneed surgery— it is superb — 3-in-1 toilets — just don’t work — they are always too “small” regardless of who is sitting on them — and they are difficult to sit down and get up from ... ...I cannot recommend this enough — my wife feels secure and safe with this.This latest model, addresses any concerns previously mentioned in earlier comments... But it!!
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph J. Fiorillo

customer_reviews.title: More stable than most!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an elderly lady who had used the other type that connects to the back of the toilet. This is much more stable but I had to buy double sided carpet tape to keep it from sliding. I wish the handles were a bit higher because the person who is using it was use to the other handles being a couple of inches higher. The physical therapist who is working with her wanted to know where I had bought this she she could refer it to other patients. It is steel and much more sturdy than the other ones on the market but it will slide for someone who is not stable on their feet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Igo

customer_reviews.title: Of all the purchases made to accommodate my recent total ...
customer_reviews.text: Of all the purchases made to accommodate my recent total hip replacement surgery, this is one of the most used. Placed in front of the toilet, it greatly helped in setting down and getting up. I just wish it had little rubber feet on the long legs to prevent it from sliding on bathroom tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Suggestion
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for six months and It has been a life saver. Since these are mostly used by older people you need to paint them with rust proof paint. If you're a male and close to 70 you will know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for my relative as she has been waiting for her hip surgery. Very easy to assemble, looks better than other models, and extremely sturdy for her (185lbs). Very pleased, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Not safe! The rear of this tips forward when usesD making it unsafe for elderly. Retuned
customer_reviews.author: Traci Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dependable, and easily assembled
customer_reviews.text: This is great for larger men or women. My husband did not want to use a free standing toilet. This product was easy to assemble with wing nuts. It is available for stability when needed without being in the way. It will easily come apart for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2praizHim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, portable, and no installation.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom, who uses a walker and needs help to stand. The great things - no installation, portable, and sturdy. We have one at our house for my husband, which we use to take with us on trips where there won’t be bars for the toilet... like to visit family members. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Lake Bloomfield

customer_reviews.title: Broken back, this helps!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight yet sturdy. Keep downward pressure when using it. Don’t push outward as it doesn’t have very strong bracing in that respect. Ya not flimsy or wobbly when used properly. More of an assisting device than a load bearing device. Installs fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Working Class Family

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as advertised. It was easy to assemble and put in place. It is sitting on a tile floor and does have a tendency to slide easily, however since it backs against the toilet it can't push away too much. I will probably end up putting something under it to reduce/eliminate the slide. I recently had one knee replaced and am getting ready to have the same done to the other knee. For me this is just the thing.
customer_reviews.author: SW Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to tight quarters
customer_reviews.text: My mother has been suffering from sudden dizzy spells, and we needed a way for her to safely get onto and off of the toilet. The Drive Medical Stand offered a solution that did not require extensive remodeling of the bathroom and that didn't take too much space in an already cramped bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H. Merchant

customer_reviews.title: It was much too wide for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Drive always has good quality, so I ordered this for a sick relative who was in the hospital. The bathroom was much too small for this to be used and I had to return it. Good product though.
customer_reviews.author: H-Spike

customer_reviews.title: Portable, simple support.
customer_reviews.text: Installing permanent pull bars in a bathroom is expensive and in walls with plumbing, potentially dangerous. This is the perfect solution, even in a small space it works, and you can move it easily when cleaning. Very simple to assemble, great for anyone with back, knee or hip issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey C

customer_reviews.title: Mom didn't admit she needed it but loves it now.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 95-year-old mother who lives independently. We were going to a resort for a big family reunion and knew that her assigned room did not have handicap railings. So it was perfect. Easy to put together. Light weight. Now she even uses it at home instead of the window sill beside the toilet. It's easy to pull out so that the floor can be mopped around the toilet. She was NOT going to admit that she needed this aid but now she loves it and I got lots of brownie points for getting it for her quickly on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kay H. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: A must for the visiting aging parent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for when my aging parent comes visiting and otherwise I leave it sitting in tub, out of the way from everyone else. It was easy to install and light to move around.
customer_reviews.author: skippy

customer_reviews.title: easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: i have a stone bathroom floor so not completly uniform easy fix just used those stick on furniture grip cushions also i hung a second wider wire basket for tp holder on other side
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ray

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Stand Alone Toilet Safety Rail, White, EA
product_meta.description: If you suffer from poor balance, arthritis, limited mobility, or injury issues, you know how difficult many everyday activities can be. Don't let something as simple as using the bathroom be one of them! Using the Toilet Safety Rail offers secure assistance when sitting on, or standing up from, the toilet. This free standing unit is assembled easily without tools to surround your existing toilet, whether standard or elongated. The padded handles are easy to grip and comfortable to rest your arms on. It even has a handy magazine rack attached to keep your reading materials in reach!
feature_bullets: Freestanding around toilet to fit both standard and elongated seat toilets
Comes with padded armrests for added comfort
Width Between Arms: 21"; Arm Height: 25.5"; Weight Capacity: 300 lbs
